channel.title: Data Science Portfolio on Meyke
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science Portfolio on Meyke

item.title: WiDS climate change 2022
item.description: This years Women In Data Science competition was about Climate Change. Based on a dataset consisting of several building features as well as climate and weather features, we were asked to predict the energy consumption of several buildings. To do so, I teamed up with Brenda Loznik. As with all challenges, we started this adventure by doing some Exploratory Data Analysis. Not only did this give us a good idea of the data that we were dealing with, we also realized that we had several observations in the dataset that belonged to the same buildings.

item.title: Vendee Globe
item.description: To date, the Vend√©e Globe is the greatest sailing race round the world, solo, non-stop and without assistance, various sailors travel the seas. The competitors undertake a circumnavigation via the three capes (Good Hope, Leeuwin and Horn). The Vendee Globe is now called the Everest of the seas and is an extraordinary race. In order to visualise this race, I created a Lambda architecture. A real-time layer to display the current location of the sailors at all time.

item.title: News Headlines Analysis
item.description: I analysed a news dataset from 2014 with the primary objective to gain insight on some of the more important things that happened during the timeframe covered by the dataset. First, I did some data cleaning in excel and notepad++. After, I first did some exploratory data analysis in python. It allowed me to take a closer look at the data, clean it even further and create some additional features. I extracted, for example the locations that appeared in the headlines.

item.title: Disaster Tweets
item.description: The “getting started with NLP” Kaggle competition is the Disaster News dataset. Given a large amount of tweets, all classified with a theme, it is your taks to predict which tweets are about a real disaster and which are not. In short, this challenge is all about the nuance that is embodied in language. In the Exploratory Data Analysis phase, I created a lot of new features: average word length, count of special characters, amount of retweets, and so on.

item.title: Customer Sentiment Analysis
item.description: As our final assignment for the Techionista Academy, we had to create a Power BI report to analyse the customer sentiment for a Dutch company. Unfortunately, we have been asked to be careful with the data we share since it contains privacy sensitive information. Therefore, I won’t be able to share my code or the Power BI report itself. Instead, I will share screenshots of the result. The data that was provided consisted of the following columns:

item.title: Predict House Prices
item.description: The goal of the Kaggle House Prices Prediction contest is to predict the final price for each home in Ames, Iowa (United States). The contest provides 79 variables for each home, making it a challenge to be creative and selective with feature engineering. I submitted 7 predictions to Kaggle. My higest score was 0.12881, good for a 2380 place on the leadership board with a total of 8972 teams. In order to be able to build a lineair regression model to predict the house prices, I first cleaned the data and imputed missing values.

item.title: Titanic
item.description: The Kaggle Titanic competition is one of the most well known machine learning competitions out there. The goal is to predict the fate of the passengers onboard of the Titanic. Did they survive the 1912 disaster? The Titanic competition was the first machine learning competition I participated in. After several submissions, I finally reached a top 6% score (place 1820 out of 33866 enrolled teams) with a Kaggle accuracy rate of 0.
